suff. (-am is in many cases clearly used enclitic and in order to fill a metrical foot. It expresses a certain quasi-genitivic affiliation of two subsequent nouns, which usually need not be marked in a noun string: the desert endowed with Kaḷḷi trees of 16.5. The semantical base of “being pretty by” is sometimes still to be felt. The actual adjective meaning “pretty” nearly always opens a metrical foot.)
